name: restore-terminals
description: Configure how your integrated VSCode terminals open at startup

restoreTerminals.runOnStartup.description: Whether or not to restore the terminals when VSCode starts up.

restoreTerminals.keepExistingTerminalsOp.description: Whether or not to keep any currently open terminals open when restoring.

restoreTerminals.artificialDelayMillisec.description: If you find restore terminals glitching out, or running some commands in the wrong window, you might want to try increasing this number to further delay the processing of actions. If you find it taking too long to open the terminal windows, you can try reducing this number, be be cautious as if it's too fast it will bug out.

name.description: The name to give the terminal window

commands.description: The shell commands to execute when this terminal opens.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
